iq_verdict_score.description: IQ Verdict Score - The main score (e.g. 74/100) shown on the VerdictIQ page. Composite of four weighted components. Used only on the Verdict page; worksheets use Deal Opportunity Score instead.

iq_verdict_composite.formula: composite = deal_gap×0.35 + return_quality×0.30 + market_alignment×0.20 + deal_probability×0.15; result clamped to 5-95
iq_verdict_composite.description: Weighted composite score displayed as the Verdict score (e.g. 74/100).

deal_gap_component.formula: deal_gap_pct = (list_price - target_price) / list_price × 100; score 0-90 from bands (gap ≤-10%, ≤0%, ≤10%, ≤25%, ≤40%, else). Target_price = income_value × (1 - buy_discount_pct)
deal_gap_component.description: Measures how favorably the property is priced relative to Target Buy price.

return_quality_component.description: Derived from the best-performing strategy score (LTR, STR, BRRRR, Flip, House Hack, Wholesale).

deal_probability_component.formula: max_discount = (motivation_score/100)×0.25; ratio = deal_gap_pct/100 / max_discount; score 5-90 from ratio bands (≤0.6, ≤1.0, ≤1.5, else)
deal_probability_component.description: Likelihood of achieving the required discount given seller motivation.

wholesale_price_target.description: Wholesale as a price target on the Verdict price ladder (e.g. '30% net discount'). The displayed wholesale price comes from backend strategy or worksheet MAO.
wholesale_price_target.usage: VerdictIQ price ladder (wholesale card); Worksheet wholesale (MAO).

wholesale_mao_verdict.description: Max Allowable Offer in Verdict context. Used for wholesale strategy metric; fee is 0.7% of purchase price.

wholesale_70_rule_worksheet.formula: seventy_pct_max_offer = arv × (1 - arv_discount_pct) - estimated_rehab_costs; default arv_discount_pct = 0.30 (30% discount = 70% rule)
wholesale_70_rule_worksheet.description: 70% rule: MAO = ARV×70% minus rehab. Worksheet and analytics use this; default 30% discount from ARV.

market_price_off_market.description: Market Price is the value displayed when the property is not listed (status off-market). When the property is listed, Market Price = List Price (asking price). Off-market Market Price gives DealGapIQ a proprietary blended number different from single-source sites.
market_price_off_market.usage: Property API valuations.market_price; Verdict request/response when off-market (list_price = market price).

market_price_listed.description: When property is actively listed, Market Price is the list (asking) price.

market_price_off_market.formula: (1) (Zestimate + RentCast AVM) / 2 when both available; (2) if one missing, use the other; (3) if both missing, use calculated Income Value; (4) if still none, use tax_assessed_value / 0.75
market_price_off_market.description: Off-market only. Two-source blended average when both Zestimate and RentCast AVM exist; otherwise single source, then Income Value, then tax/0.75.

market_statistics.description: Market health indicators from RentCast saleData for buyer/seller market analysis

median_days_on_market.description: The median number of days properties stay on market before selling. Key indicator of market velocity.

avg_days_on_market.description: The average number of days properties stay on market. May be skewed by outliers.

min_days_on_market.description: The fastest sale in the market. Indicates demand for well-priced properties.

max_days_on_market.description: The longest time on market. Properties priced too high or with issues.

total_listings.description: Total active inventory in the market area.

new_listings.description: Number of new listings added in the most recent period.

absorption_rate.description: Rate at which new inventory enters the market relative to total inventory. Higher rate indicates faster-moving market (seller's market). Lower rate indicates slower market with aging inventory (buyer's market).
absorption_rate.interpretation: 0.10+ = Fast absorption (seller's market), 0.05-0.10 = Normal, <0.05 = Slow absorption (buyer's market)

market_temperature.formula: if median_days_on_market < 30: 'hot' (seller's market); elif median_days_on_market <= 60: 'warm' (balanced); else: 'cold' (buyer's market)
market_temperature.description: Classification of market conditions based on days on market.

interpretation.hot: Seller's market - Properties sell quickly. Limited negotiation room. Expected discount: 0-3%.
interpretation.warm: Balanced market - Normal conditions. Moderate negotiation possible. Expected discount: 3-7%.
interpretation.cold: Buyer's market - High inventory, properties sit longer. Strong negotiation leverage. Expected discount: 7-15%.

median_price.description: Median sale price in the market area.

avg_price_per_sqft.description: Average price per square foot in the market area. Useful for quick valuation comparisons.

rental_market_statistics.description: Rental market statistics from RentCast rentalData and Zillow for rental investment analysis
rental_market_statistics.source: RentCast Markets API (rentalData), Zillow Property API (rentZestimate), Zillow Market API (medianRentPriceOverTime)

rental_rentcast_estimate.description: RentCast's property-specific rent estimate based on comparable rentals.

rental_zillow_estimate.description: Zillow's estimated monthly rent (rentZestimate) for the property.

iq_estimate.formula: iq_estimate = (rental_rentcast_estimate + rental_zillow_estimate) / 2; if only one source available, uses that value
iq_estimate.description: DealGapIQ proprietary rent estimate. Averages RentCast and Zillow estimates when both are available to provide a more balanced estimate. When only one source is available, uses that value with reduced confidence.
iq_estimate.notes: This is a unique DealGapIQ metric that combines the best data from both sources.

market_avg_rent.description: Average rent in the market area across all rental listings.

market_median_rent.description: Median rent in the market area. Less affected by outliers than average.

market_min_rent.description: Minimum rent in the market area. Represents floor of rental market.

market_max_rent.description: Maximum rent in the market area. Represents ceiling of rental market.

market_rent_per_sqft.description: Average rent per square foot in the market. Useful for comparing rental efficiency.

rental_days_on_market.description: Median number of days rental listings stay on market. Lower values indicate high rental demand.

rental_total_listings.description: Total number of active rental listings in the market area.

rental_new_listings.description: Number of new rental listings added in the most recent period.

rent_trend.description: Direction of rental market trend based on year-over-year comparison. Uses ±2% threshold to filter noise.

interpretation.up: Rents are rising - favorable for landlords, may support higher rent assumptions
interpretation.down: Rents are falling - be conservative with rent projections
interpretation.stable: Rents are flat - use current market rates for projections

rent_trend_pct.formula: rent_trend_pct = (current_year_avg - prev_year_avg) / prev_year_avg; where current_year_avg = avg(medianRentPriceOverTime.currentYear[*].price); prev_year_avg = avg(medianRentPriceOverTime.prevYear[*].price)
rent_trend_pct.description: Year-over-year percentage change in median rents. Positive values indicate rent growth, negative values indicate rent decline.
rent_trend_pct.notes: Calculated from Zillow's medianRentPriceOverTime which provides monthly rent data for current and previous year.

deal_opportunity_score.description: Deal Opportunity Score - Used on Worksheets and Deal Score flow (POST /api/v1/worksheet/deal-score). Weights: deal_gap 50%, availability 30%, DOM 20%. For the Verdict page score (74/100 style), see iq_verdict_score.
notes: Equity % is excluded as mortgage balance data is not available from the Axesso API (would require public records data).
BRRRR, Fix & Flip, and Wholesale strategies require physical inspection for repair estimates.
The Deal Score is based on LTR Income Value since it can be calculated from available market data.

deal_opportunity_score.description: Composite weighted score (0-100) combining Deal Gap, Availability Ranking, and Days on Market factors.

deal_gap.formula: deal_gap = (list_price - target_price) / list_price × 100; target_price = income_value × (1 - buy_discount_pct); deal_gap_score = max(0, min(100, 100 - (deal_gap × 100 / 45)))
deal_gap.description: Primary factor (50% weight). Deal Gap uses Target Price (Income Value minus buy discount). Measures how much discount from list price is needed to reach target. A positive gap means the list price is above target (need discount). A negative gap means property is already profitable at list price.

interpretation.0%_gap: 100 score - Property profitable at list price

ltr_income_value.formula: income_value = NOI / (LTV × mortgage_constant); where NOI = effective_gross_income - operating_expenses; effective_gross_income = monthly_rent × 12 × (1 - vacancy_rate); operating_expenses = property_taxes + insurance + (effective_gross_income × maintenance_pct) + (effective_gross_income × management_pct); LTV = 1 - down_payment_pct; mortgage_constant = (monthly_rate × (1 + monthly_rate)^n) / ((1 + monthly_rate)^n - 1) × 12
ltr_income_value.description: The Income Value — the purchase price at which rental income exactly covers all operating expenses and debt service. Used as the basis for Deal Gap calculation.

availability_ranking.formula: availability_score based on listing status rank (1-9, where 1 = best opportunity)
availability_ranking.description: Seller motivation factor (30% weight). Ranks properties by likelihood of successful negotiation based on listing status and seller type.

dom_score.formula: dom_score = f(days_on_market, deal_gap_percent); scoring varies based on DOM thresholds (30, 60, 120 days) and deal gap thresholds (10%, 25%)
dom_score.description: Days on Market factor (20% weight). Score considers DOM in context of Deal Gap to assess negotiation leverage.

interpretation.high_gap_high_dom: 100 score - Strong negotiation leverage (seller may be desperate)
interpretation.high_gap_low_dom: 60 score - Opportunity not yet recognized by market
interpretation.low_gap_high_dom: 50 score - Price may already be fair (not much room)
interpretation.low_gap_low_dom: 30 score - Hot property, move fast if interested

leverage_levels.high: High Deal Gap (25%+) + High DOM (120+ days)
leverage_levels.medium: Medium Deal Gap (10-25%) or Medium DOM (30-120 days)
leverage_levels.low: Low Deal Gap (<10%) or Low DOM (<30 days)

pricing_quality.formula: pricing_quality_tier based on income_gap_percent = (list_price - income_value) / list_price × 100; Tiers: <=0% below_income_value, 0-5% investment_grade, 5-10% fair, 10-20% above_income_value, 20-30% overpriced, 30%+ substantially_overpriced
pricing_quality.description: Internal pricing quality assessment based on how the asking price relates to the property's Income Value. Used to generate contextual verdict explanations.

performance_scores.description: Strategy Performance Scores - Measures how well a property performs for each investment strategy. Uses a unified formula: score = 50 + (metric × multiplier), centered at 50 for breakeven performance.
notes: All scores use the same base formula: score = 50 + (metric_value × multiplier)
Score of 50 represents breakeven (0% return or 0% benefit)
Score of 100 represents excellent performance (varies by strategy)
Score of 0 represents poor performance (significant losses)
All scores are clamped to 0-100 range
The IQ Verdict page and Worksheets now use identical formulas for consistency

unified_formula.description: Centers at 50 for breakeven, with positive/negative returns adjusting the score up/down

brrrr.notes: Higher multiplier (1.0) rewards strong cash recovery as this is the primary BRRRR goal

house_hack.notes: Higher multiplier (1.0) rewards strong housing cost reduction as this is the primary house hack goal

wholesale.example: At $10K assignment fee on $5K EMD = 200% ROI: score = 50 + (200 × 0.5) = 150 → capped at 100

seller_motivation_score.description: Seller Motivation Score - Investment Negotiation Leverage. Analyzes multiple data signals to determine seller motivation level and potential negotiation leverage for investors. Higher score = more motivated seller = better negotiation leverage.
notes: Indicators are weighted by signal strength: HIGH (3.0), MEDIUM-HIGH (2.5), MEDIUM (2.0), LOW (1.0)
Only detected indicators are included in the composite score calculation
Some indicators are partially available or inferred from available data
Estate/Probate Sale and Tenant Issues indicators are NOT AVAILABLE (require external data sources)

seller_motivation_score.formula: seller_motivation_score = Σ(indicator_score × indicator_weight) / Σ(indicator_weight) for all detected indicators
seller_motivation_score.description: Composite weighted score (0-100) combining all detected motivation indicators. Only indicators with detected=true are included in the calculation.

days_on_market.formula: if days >= 180: score=100; elif days >= 120: score=85; elif days >= 90: score=70; elif days >= 60: score=55; elif days >= 30: score=35; else: score=15; // Boost +15 if DOM >= 2× market_median_dom
days_on_market.description: Longer days on market indicates seller fatigue and increased negotiation leverage. Score is boosted if property DOM significantly exceeds market average.

price_reductions.formula: if price_reduction_count >= 3: score=100; elif count == 2: score=80; elif count == 1: score=50; // Boost +10 if total_price_reduction_pct > 10%
price_reductions.description: Multiple price reductions indicate failed pricing strategy and seller flexibility. Extracted by analyzing AXESSO priceHistory events.
price_reductions.data_extraction: Loop through priceHistory[].priceChangeRate < 0 or event contains 'price change'/'reduced'

withdrawn_expired_listing.formula: if is_withdrawn OR listing_status contains 'WITHDRAWN' OR 'EXPIRED': score=95
withdrawn_expired_listing.description: Previously listed but didn't sell publicly - high motivation likely as seller has already tried conventional methods.

foreclosure_distress.formula: if is_pre_foreclosure: score=100; elif is_foreclosure: score=95; elif is_bank_owned: score=85; elif is_auction: score=80
foreclosure_distress.description: Financial distress indicators provide maximum negotiation leverage. Pre-foreclosure has urgent timeline. Bank-owned properties (REO) are typically priced to move inventory.

interpretation.pre-foreclosure: Urgent timeline, owner facing foreclosure - maximum leverage
interpretation.auction: Seller seeking quick sale through competitive bidding

absentee_ownership.formula: if is_non_owner_occupied == true OR owner_occupied == false: score=70
absentee_ownership.description: Non-owner occupied properties are treated as investments rather than homes. Sellers are typically less emotionally attached and more willing to negotiate on numbers.

out_of_state_owner.description: Distance reduces emotional attachment. Out-of-state owners may be more motivated to sell to reduce management burden.
out_of_state_owner.data_source: RentCast Properties API - owner.mailingAddress.state compared to property.state

likely_vacant.formula: if is_non_owner_occupied == true AND listing_status != 'FOR_RENT': score=60
likely_vacant.description: Inferred vacancy - property is not owner-occupied and not listed for rent, suggesting it may be vacant. Vacant properties incur carrying costs without income.
likely_vacant.notes: This is an INFERRED indicator, not directly available from API data

poor_condition.description: Property condition inferred from listing description text analysis. Keywords like 'as-is', 'fixer', 'TLC', 'investor special' indicate properties that need work and have limited buyer pools.
poor_condition.notes: PARTIAL indicator - relies on text analysis of description field

possibly_inherited.description: A last sale price of $0 or $1 often indicates a gift or inheritance transfer. Inherited properties may be sold by heirs who are not emotionally attached.
possibly_inherited.notes: PARTIAL indicator - $0/$1 sale is a common pattern for inheritance but not definitive

fsbo.description: For Sale By Owner - more direct negotiation without agent buffer. FSBO sellers are sometimes more flexible to avoid paying commission.

owner_occupied.description: COUNTER-INDICATOR: Owner-occupied properties typically have emotional pricing and harder negotiation. Low score reflects reduced motivation.
owner_occupied.notes: This indicator REDUCES the overall motivation score when detected

selling_soon_prediction.description: Zillow's proprietary prediction of likelihood the property will sell soon. Higher percentile indicates higher likelihood.
selling_soon_prediction.notes: BONUS indicator - only included when data is available from AXESSO

estate_probate_sale.description: Estate or probate sales indicate inherited property being sold by executor. Would require court records or MLS probate flag.

tenant_issues.description: Properties with difficult tenants or eviction history may have motivated landlord sellers.
tenant_issues.data_needed: Property management records, eviction court records

total_operating_expenses.formula: total_operating_expenses = property_taxes + insurance + property_management + maintenance + utilities + landscaping + pest_control + hoa_fees

ten_year_projection.formula: Per year: gross_rent = annual_gross_rent*(1+rent_growth_rate)^(year-1), expenses = total_operating_expenses*(1+expense_growth_rate)^(year-1), noi = gross_rent*(1-vacancy_rate)-expenses, cash_flow = noi - annual_debt_service, property_value = purchase_price*(1+appreciation_rate)^year, equity = property_value - (loan_amount*(1-(year/loan_term_years)*0.3))

income_value.formula: income_value = NOI / (LTV * mortgage_constant); where NOI = effective_gross_income - operating_expenses; LTV = 1 - down_payment_pct; mortgage_constant = (monthly_rate * (1 + monthly_rate)^n) / ((1 + monthly_rate)^n - 1) * 12
income_value.description: The Income Value — the purchase price at which rental income exactly covers all operating expenses and debt service

buy_discount_pct.description: The discount percentage below Income Value to ensure profitability (default 5%)

buy_price.formula: buy_price = income_value * (1 - buy_discount_pct); capped at list_price
buy_price.description: The recommended purchase price, calculated as Income Value minus the buy discount to ensure profitability

total_operating_expenses.formula: total_operating_expenses = taxes + insurance + platform_fees + str_management + cleaning_costs + supplies + utilities + maintenance + landscaping + pest_control + hoa_annual

break_even_occupancy.formula: break_even_occupancy = break_even_nights / 365; break_even_nights = fixed_costs / revenue_per_night_net; revenue_per_night_net = ADR - variable_cost_per_night
break_even_occupancy.description: The minimum occupancy rate needed to cover all fixed costs and debt service

income_value.formula: income_value = NOI / (LTV * mortgage_constant); where NOI = total_gross_revenue - total_operating_expenses; uses same formula as LTR but with STR revenue assumptions
income_value.description: The Income Value — the purchase price at which rental income exactly covers all operating expenses and debt service at the given occupancy and ADR

buy_discount_pct.description: The discount percentage below Income Value to ensure profitability (default 5%)

buy_price.formula: buy_price = income_value * (1 - buy_discount_pct); capped at list_price
buy_price.description: The recommended purchase price, calculated as Income Value minus the buy discount to ensure profitability

seasonality_analysis.formula: Hardcoded seasonal buckets using ADR and occupancy adjustments

cash_required_phase2.formula: cash_required_phase2 = total_rehab + holding_costs; total_rehab = renovation_budget + contingency

operating_expenses_note.notes: insurance_annual is referenced in code but not defined in function signature

income_value.formula: income_value = NOI / (LTV * mortgage_constant); uses post-rehab rent and refinance terms; where NOI = (post_rehab_monthly_rent * 12 * (1 - vacancy_rate)) - operating_expenses
income_value.description: The Income Value — the purchase price at which post-refinance rental income exactly covers all operating expenses and debt service

buy_discount_pct.description: The discount percentage below Income Value to ensure profitability (default 5%)

buy_price.formula: buy_price = income_value * (1 - buy_discount_pct); capped at list_price
buy_price.description: The recommended purchase price, calculated as Income Value minus the buy discount to ensure profitability

total_holding_costs.formula: total_holding_costs = hard_money_interest + property_taxes + insurance + utilities + security_maintenance

total_project_cost.formula: total_project_cost = purchase_price + closing_costs + inspection_costs + total_renovation + total_holding_costs

minimum_sale_for_breakeven.description: The minimum sale price needed to recover all project costs after paying selling costs (typically 8%)

breakeven_effective_housing_cost.formula: breakeven achieved when effective_housing_cost <= 0; effective_housing_cost = total_monthly_expenses - total_monthly_income; alternatively: breakeven when housing_cost_offset_pct >= 100%
breakeven_effective_housing_cost.description: Breakeven occurs when rental income from tenants covers 100% of your housing costs (you live for free)

buy_discount_pct.description: The discount percentage below Income Value to ensure profitability (default 5%)

buy_price.formula: buy_price = income_value * (1 - buy_discount_pct); capped at list_price
buy_price.description: The recommended purchase price, calculated as Income Value minus the buy discount to ensure profitability

deal_viability.formula: If spread >= assignment_fee + 20000 → Strong; >= +10000 → Moderate; >= assignment_fee → Tight; else Not Viable

breakeven_assignment_fee.formula: breakeven_assignment_fee = marketing_costs + closing_costs; net_profit = 0 when assignment_fee = marketing_costs + closing_costs
breakeven_assignment_fee.description: The minimum assignment fee needed to cover marketing and closing costs with $0 profit
